summary: Internal FBI email chain discussing a press conference held by the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) in front of Jeffrey Epstein's house. The emails reveal a communication failure where victims were not notified, causing anger and frustration among them. FBI agents are trying to determine what happened and how to address the victims' concerns.

persons.name: S (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: Forwarded an email chain and asked how to respond regarding the press conference communication failure.

persons.name: ME, (SE) (FBI)
persons.context: Expressed frustration about the USAO's communication failure and sought guidance on directing victim concerns.

persons.name: L. (DO) (FBI)
persons.context: Relayed information that the press conference was not planned and that SDNY/FBI were unaware, mentioning a statement about Prince Andrew.

persons.name: M, (SE) (FBI)
persons.context: Reported receiving irate communications from victims about not being notified of the press conference and sought information to address their concerns.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of the press conference held in front of his brownstone.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Referenced as a topic the USAO was asked about during the impromptu press conference.

connections.description: Both are FBI agents in the Seattle Division, coordinating on victim communications regarding the Epstein case.
FBI agents communicating about the press conference incident and victim notification issues.
FBI agents in different divisions discussing how to respond to the press conference communication failure.

events.title: USAO Press Conference at Epstein's House
events.description: A press conference was held in front of Jeffrey Epstein's brownstone, co-sponsored/hosted by Safe Horizons, without prior notification to victims or the FBI.

events.title: FBI Internal Discussion on Press Conference
events.description: FBI agents exchanged emails to address the communication breakdown and victim anger over not being notified of the press conference.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) held a press conference in front of Jeffrey Epstein's house without notifying victims or the FBI, causing significant anger among victims.
The press conference was co-sponsored/hosted by Safe Horizons, and the USAO made a statement about Prince Andrew during the event.
FBI agents described the incident as a 'clear communication failure' and sought to determine how to address victims' feelings of betrayal.
The SDNY/FBI claimed they had no prior knowledge that the press conference was going to happen.
